title: How bees help plants have sex - Fernanda S. Valdovinos

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary role of bees in the ecosystem?

options.label: B
options.text: To pollinate plants and help them reproduce

options.label: C
options.text: To produce honey for human consumption

options.label: B
options.text: They are highly complex and heterogenous

options.label: C
options.text: They are only found in natural ecosystems

options.text: They are only composed of bees and butterflies

options.label: B
options.text: It provides a diverse source of food and helps with reproduction

options.label: C
options.text: It competes with other pollinators for food

options.label: D
options.text: It has no benefit to the plant

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a nested network?

options.label: A
options.text: Specialists interact with other specialists more than with generalists

options.label: B
options.text: Specialists interact with generalists more than with other specialists

options.label: C
options.text: Generalists interact with other generalists more than with specialists

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of modularity in plant pollinator networks?

options.label: A
options.text: It increases the risk of extinction

options.label: B
options.text: It decreases the stability of ecosystems

options.label: C
options.text: It allows species to interact with each other more easily

options.label: D
options.text: It compartmentalizes species into modules that interact more with each other than with other species

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of generalist plants?

options.label: B
options.text: They have a diverse team of matchmakers

options.label: C
options.text: They are only found in natural ecosystems

options.label: D
options.text: They are only composed of bees and butterflies

multiple-choice.question: What is the importance of generalist pollinators, like bees, to the stability of ecosystems?

options.label: A
options.text: They increase the risk of extinction

options.label: B
options.text: They decrease the stability of ecosystems

options.label: C
options.text: They help to prevent and respond to extinctions

options.label: D
options.text: They have no impact on ecosystem stability

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of the relationship between plants and pollinators?

options.label: A
options.text: Plants and pollinators interact equally with each other

options.label: B
options.text: Plants provide food to pollinators and pollinators provide food to plants

options.label: C
options.text: Plants and pollinators interact in a highly heterogenous way

options.label: D
options.text: Plants and pollinators interact in a simple and linear way

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of a specialist pollinator, such as a bee that only feeds on one plant species?

options.label: A
options.text: It provides a diverse source of food

options.label: B
options.text: It helps with the reproduction of multiple plant species

options.label: C
options.text: It is less vulnerable to extinction

options.label: D
options.text: It competes with other pollinators for food

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of the structure of plant pollinator networks?

options.label: A
options.text: They are typically complex and nested

options.label: B
options.text: They are typically simple and linear

options.label: C
options.text: They are only found in natural ecosystems

options.label: D
options.text: They are only composed of bees and butterflies

title: How to choose your news - Damon Brown

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the best ways to get the truth or something close in today's media landscape?

options.label: A
options.text: By following only one trusted news source

options.label: B
options.text: By getting the original news unfiltered by middlemen

options.label: D
options.text: By not verifying news before spreading it

options.label: A
options.text: It allows for real-time updates from trusted sources

options.label: B
options.text: It can lead to incorrect information or false accusations of innocent people

options.label: C
options.text: It is a reliable source of news from multiple perspectives

options.label: D
options.text: It is a platform for only objective journalism

multiple-choice.question: Why is it important to separate fact from opinion in news reporting?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it helps to create a more balanced view of the news

options.label: B
options.text: Because it allows readers to make their own judgments about the news

options.label: C
options.text: Because it helps to avoid confusion and misinformation

multiple-choice.question: What is a potential issue with reports that rely on anonymous sources?

options.label: A
options.text: They are always accurate and reliable

options.label: B
options.text: They are never biased or influenced by personal interests

options.label: C
options.text: They could be people with little connection to the story or an interest in influencing coverage

options.label: D
options.text: They are never used in investigative journalism

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the responsibilities that comes with freedom from media gatekeepers?

options.label: A
options.text: To only follow trusted news sources

options.label: B
options.text: To curate our own experience and ensure that the flow of information does not become a flood

options.label: C
options.text: To not verify news before spreading it

options.label: D
options.text: To rely only on social media for news

multiple-choice.question: Why is it a good idea to check for the latest information at several points in the day, rather than every few minutes, during chaotic events?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it allows for real-time updates from trusted sources

options.label: B
options.text: Because it helps to avoid confusion and misinformation

options.label: C
options.text: Because it allows time for complete details to emerge and false reports to be refuted

options.label: D
options.text: Because it is a reliable source of news from multiple perspectives

multiple-choice.question: What is a potential issue with mainstream sources presenting official narratives?

options.label: A
options.text: They are always accurate and reliable

options.label: B
options.text: They are never biased or influenced by personal interests

options.label: C
options.text: They can be misleading the public, often with media cooperation

options.label: D
options.text: They are never used in investigative journalism

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the benefits of following reporters on social media during current events?

options.label: A
options.text: It allows for real-time updates from trusted sources

options.label: B
options.text: It can lead to incorrect information or false accusations of innocent people

options.label: C
options.text: It provides updates and recordings from the midst of the chaos

options.label: D
options.text: It is a reliable source of news from multiple perspectives

multiple-choice.question: Why is it important to verify news before spreading it on social media?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it helps to create a more balanced view of the news

options.label: B
options.text: Because it allows readers to make their own judgments about the news

options.label: C
options.text: Because it helps to avoid confusion and misinformation

multiple-choice.question: What is a potential issue with polished versions of news reports that combine the voice of the person who was there with the input of editors who weren't?

options.label: A
options.text: They are always accurate and reliable

options.label: B
options.text: They are never biased or influenced by personal interests

options.label: C
options.text: They can be misleading or inaccurate

options.label: D
options.text: They are never used in investigative journalism
